skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Just the rumour of him unmans weak commanders before blades are drawn.

skillTree.localised_description: Maybe it is the near-constant state of regeneration that gives the hide a toughened sheen, almost impervious to claw, talon or blade.
He drinks as he fights — endlessly, without pause, and never defeated.

Dwarf beer resource production: 3 kegs
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Where Haraldur walks, Huscarls rally. Roads crack beneath his weight and will.

skillTree.localised_description: His charge hits like a mammoth wearing plate.

skillTree.localised_description: Chosen by High Jarl Geimdall to break sieges, shieldwalls, and spirits alike.

skillTree.localised_description: A single throw begins the bloodshed — and ends many lives.
Spears that crack shields; shieldwork that crushes skulls. That is Haraldur’s craft.

	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Station him anywhere — and none shall pass without cost.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unyielding Assault for Haraldur's Huscarls
	(Hero's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can never have its Melee Attack reduced during battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

items.colour_text: Fellhewer is no ornate relic, no daemon-forged abomination, nor dwarfen rune-thrust marvel — it is brutal Norscan craftsmanship at its most primal. A spear of ashwood thick as a man's forearm, its tip is a jagged shard of wyrdstone-steel, hammered flat with the weight of storms and sharpened on glacier-stone. It bears no inscriptions, only deep battle-notches and dark stains that no sea can wash away. Forged long ago in the Bjornling tribe's coastal forge-pits, it was intended as a ship-spear to slay sea serpents and krakens that threatened the longships. But in Haraldur's hand, it found new purpose — hurled from behind the shieldwall, it has ended trolls, shaggy mammoths, and worse. Some say it chooses when to strike, not Haraldur, for he only throws when death is already near.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

items.colour_text: Fashioned from a slab of wyr-stone scavenged from the ruins of a Chaos-tainted keep, this shield is heavier than most men can lift. Runes of warding and endurance line its battered face, their glow dulled by age but not by function. Haraldur used it to withstand a firewyrm’s breath during a raid in the east, and since then, the shield has become a symbol of steadfastness and defiance. Those who strike it claim to hear whispers — the voice of the wyrm whose flame could not burn it.

Plundered from the wreck of the Deepwhisker, this iron-bound tankard once sloshed on the belt of Skarrik Foambeard, the infamous Dwarf privateer who roamed the Sea of Claws in the age of salt and steel. The brew within — a thick, sea-aged ale flavoured with barnacle sap and powdered coral — somehow still refills after every battle, whether Haraldur wills it or not. Its warmth steadies the hand and hollows the fear, emboldening Haraldur with the strength of old sea-raiders past.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Geimdall is the voice. I am the blow."
